Class UnitTestRunner

java.lang.Object
UnitTestRunner
public class UnitTestRunner
extends Object
Executes Unit Tests by loading a file with commands, calling processCommand() and comparing the result with the expected results. It will sum up points. It may have sub sections. It will generate a summary report at the end. Can create unit test files by recording a session.

    • UnitTestRunner

      public UnitTestRunner()

  • Method Details

    • processCommand

      public static boolean processCommand​(String input, UnitTestRunner.CommandHandler cmdHandler)
      Processes the command if it is a Test command.
      Parameters:
      input - The command string that the user entered to be processed.
      cmdHandler - Callback to processCommand.
      Returns:
      true if the command was a Test command. This means that the caller should ignore the input. False means the caller should proceed to process the command.

    • runCheckpointTests

      private static void runCheckpointTests​(String checkpoint, boolean breakOnFail, UnitTestRunner.CommandHandler cmdHandler)

    • generateTestCommand

      private static boolean generateTestCommand​(String input)
      Checks if input is "test create #"

      If the input is of that form, it will redirect output to a file. When done with the tests, the user should enter, "test end"

      Parameters:
      input - The command string that the user entered to be processed.
      Returns:
      true if the command was processed

    • runTestCommand

      private static boolean runTestCommand​(String input, UnitTestRunner.CommandHandler cmdHandler)
      If the input is a Test command, it runs the series of tests found in that file. The command is in the format:
      • test {checkpoint name/#} [boolean:break_on_fail]
      • Examples:
        • test 1
        • test final
        • test extra true
      The [boolean:break_on_fail] is defaulted to FALSE.
      Parameters:
      input - The command that the user input.
      cmdHandler - : Callback to processCommand.
      Returns:
      true if the was a Test command and tests were run

    • runTests

      private static void runTests​(String filename, boolean breakOnFail, UnitTestRunner.CommandHandler cmdHandler)
      This will open a file and run the commands found inside of it. Subsequent lines will contain the expected output of running the command. The format is:

      <command> <# of lines in expected output> <expected output, if any> Examples include:

      a1 = 7 0 value a1 1 7.0

      Parameters:
      filename - is the name of the test file
      breakOnFail - If true, stop at the first failure
      cmdHandler - : Callback to processCommand.

    • runTests

      private static double runTests​(Scanner file, boolean breakOnFail, ArrayList<String> summary, UnitTestRunner.CommandHandler cmdHandler)
      Runs the tests in a file, breaking as necessary and adding to the summary results.
      Parameters:
      file - The Scanner for the file to test
      breakOnFail - If true, then stop tests at first exception, otherwise, keep on running the tests in the file
      summary - The summary data as a list of strings
      cmdHandler - Callback to processCommand.
      Returns:
      Total points earned

    • startTimeout

      private static double startTimeout​(Scanner file, int timeout, boolean breakOnFail, UnitTestRunner.CommandHandler cmdHandler)

    • multiLineMatch

      private static boolean multiLineMatch​(String actualFull, String[] expected)
